Carpaccio Of Pineapple Served With A Yogurt Sorbet

  • Serves 4-6
  • Source of Recipe Paul Merrett
  • Preparation Time 10 to 30 mins
  • Cooking Time Less than 10 mins
Ingredients
  • 300ml/10floz milk
  • 310g/10¼oz caster sugar
  • 30g/1oz glucose (buy from specialist cake supplies shop or a chemist)
  • 2 stems of lemongrass, smashed and then cut into 2-3cm/¾-1¼in sticks
  • 3 green cardamom pods, smashed
  • 2 vanilla pods, split lengthways
  • 400g/14oz Greek yoghurt
  • 75ml/2½floz double cream
  • 1 medium pineapple
Method

  • In a pan bring the milk, sugar and glucose to the boil. Add the lemongrass, cardamoms, vanilla pods and bring back to the boil. Allow to cool. Strain through a fine sieve.

  • When cooled (and strained), fold in the Greek yogurt and cream.

  • Pour the mixture into an ice cream machine and churn until thick and creamy. The sorbet is now ready to serve or alternatively turn into a suitable container and store in the freezer.

  • Next prepare the pineapple. Trim the ends and peel off the skin. Cut the pineapple in half and remove the core and slice the flesh very thinly with a sharp knife.

  • To serve, arrange 4 slices of pineapple on each plate. Top with a scoop of the sorbet.

Published: July 22 2012
